com.tellerulam.logic4mqtt.api

Class Events

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tellerulam.logic4mqtt.api.Events

  • public class Events
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages event handlers.

        public int onChangeTo(java.lang.String topicPattern,
                      java.lang.Object value,
                      EventCallbackInterface callback)
        Add an Event Handler on the specified topic pattern. It is triggered when the topic changes to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        topicPattern - a RegEx matching topics
        value -
        callback -
        Returns:
        id of the new handler (to be used with e.g. remove)

      • onChangeTo

        public int onChangeTo(java.lang.String topicPattern,
                      java.lang.Object[] values,
                      EventCallbackInterface callback)
        Add an Event Handler on the specified topic pattern. It is triggered when the topic changes to any of the the specified values.
        Parameters:
        topicPattern - a RegEx matching topics
        values -
        callback -
        Returns:
        id of the new handler (to be used with e.g. remove)

      • onChange

        public int onChange(java.lang.String topicPattern,
                    EventCallbackInterface callback)
        Add an Event Handler on the specified topic pattern. It is triggered when the topic changes from the previous value.
        Parameters:
        topicPattern - a RegEx matching topics
        callback -
        Returns:
        id of the new handler (to be used with e.g. remove)

      • onUpdate

        public int onUpdate(java.lang.String topicPattern,
                    EventCallbackInterface callback)
        Add an Event Handler on the specified topic pattern. It is triggered when the topic is being published to, regardless of the value.
        Parameters:
        topicPattern - a RegEx matching topics
        callback -
        Returns:
        id of the new handler (to be used with e.g. remove)

      • add

        public int add(java.lang.String topicPattern,
               EventCallbackInterface callback,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> params)
        Add an Event Handler using a description object (e.g. JSON object from Javascript)
        Parameters:
        topicPattern -
        callback -
        params - Map with parameters: values - value or array of values which trigger the event change - bool: whether to run only on changes of the value oneshot - bool: whether to remove the event handler after it run once
        Returns:
        id of the new handler (to be used with e.g. remove)

        public boolean remove(int id)
        Removes an event handler which was added with one of the on...() methods.
        Parameters:
        id -
        Returns:
        boolean whether an event handler with the given id was found and removed

      • queueValue

        public void queueValue(java.lang.String timespec,
                       java.lang.String topic,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        Queue an update to the specified topic with the given value at timespec. This is effectivly a shortcut for adding a timer which sets the value, with a symbolic name of _SET_topic
        Parameters:
        timespec - the timer spec
        topic - the topic to publish to
        value - the value to publish
        See Also:
        Timers

      • queueValue

        public void queueValue(java.lang.String timespec,
                       java.lang.String topic,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> value)

      • queueStore

        public void queueStore(java.lang.String timespec,
                       java.lang.String topic,
                       java.lang.Object value)
        Queue an update to the specified topic with the given value at timespec, with the retain flag set to true. This is effectivly a shortcut for adding a timer which sets the value, with a symbolic name of _SET_topic
        Parameters:
        timespec - the timer spec
        topic - the topic to publish to
        value - the value to publish
        See Also:
        Timers

                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> value)

        public int clearQueue(java.lang.String topic)
        Clears possibly queued value sets for the given topic
        Parameters:
        topic - the topic to clear the queue for
        Returns:
        number of removed queued set

                                 int generation)

        Parameters:
        topic -
        generation - (0 = current, 1 = previous, ...)
        Returns:
        the value, or null
